intro: Dactyladenia icondere, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and typically have a rough texture. Dactyladenia icondere is often found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
